body: Grasshope, As Abrham showed, you can run a window of any shape with blinds and it is just that E+'s simplified model of blinds does not work if you put them too close to the glass (or more than a meter away).   Glad that you figured out the issue with the trianges.  The general principle holds that, the cleaner your geometry that you input into Honeybee, the cleaner all future geometric operations will be off of that geometry.  To give you the power to minimize triangles for simple geometries like that here, I just implemented a new feature on the glazing by ratio component.  If you plug in quadrilateral surfaces with "breakUpWindow" set to False, you will get just one window for each surface: [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/BKb27P3JwiGaubPslDceukraz2FULCLV6tXftM47PdHXTLdVDb*Q7Hx3OuDWAU0HctZR9UZklR-xdjzI11gV49hubn7JIWIg/FalseBreakup.JPG) If you set "breakUpWindow" to True, you get a triangle with rectangles and subsequently have the ability to adjust the window and sill height on the rectangles: [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/BKb27P3JwiHJxUMSPvAd7CX3OkIWdAWcGxofNwk3eQj2QjJIFtuuj0nt3TBs5XUq8v1g6CofgUsbG879tC1rcA7qATH6haQq/TrueBreakup.JPG) -Chris
